page.title: 03 EDUCATION.
page.content: Children in both Hackleton and Denton attend their village primary schools until the year in which they are 11. The schools are designated County Primary. In 1982 Denton had a new school built as the original building in the village centre was too small. Hackleton has an extension to its original building.Both schools have mobile classrooms. After the age of 11 the pupils are taken by bus each day to the local Comprehensive school.Denton children attend Wollaston school,near Wellingborough while those from Hackleton go to Roade.In both cases the children travel about 7 miles in each direction.At 16 they are able to take either C.S.E.or G.C.E.O level examinations or a combination of both while at 18 they are able to take A level of the G.C.E.
